earwax.sound module¶

Provides the sound subsystem.

class earwax.sound.AdvancedInterfaceSoundPlayer(context: synthizer.Context, play_files: bool = True, play_directories: bool = False)¶

Bases: earwax.sound.SimpleInterfaceSoundPlayer

An interface player that can play any sound you throw at it.

To play a sound, pass a path to the play_path() method:

from pathlib import Path
from time import sleep
from synthizer import Context, initialized
from earwax import AdvancedInterfaceSoundPlayer
with initialized():
    c = Context()
    p = AdvancedInterfaceSoundPlayer(c)
    p.play_path(Path('sound.wav'))
    sleep(2)
    p.play_path(Path('move.wav'))
    sleep(2)
Variables

  • play_files – If True, then files will be played.

  • play_directories – If True, then a random file will be picked from any directory that is passed to the play_path() method.

play_directories: bool¶
play_files: bool¶
play_path(path: pathlib.Path) → None¶

If self.play_directories evaluates to True, and the given path represents a directory, play a random file from that directory. Otherwise, if self.play_files evaluates to True, play the given path.

class earwax.sound.SimpleInterfaceSoundPlayer(context: synthizer.Context, generator: synthizer.Generator, source: synthizer.Source = None)¶

Bases: object

An object which plays a sound whenever its play method is called.

The same sound will be used, and it will be restarted on each call to play.

No panning or fx are applied.

Here is a basic example:

from time import sleep
from synthizer import Context, BufferGenerator, initialize, shutdown
from earwax.sound import get_buffer, SimpleInterfaceSoundPlayer
initialize()
c = Context()
g = BufferGenerator(c)
b = get_buffer('file', 'sound.wav')
g.buffer = b
p = SimpleInterfaceSoundPlayer(c, g)
p.play()
sleep(2)
shutdown()
Variables

  • context – The audio context to use.

  • generator – The generator to use.

  • source – The source to play through.

context: synthizer.Context¶
generator: synthizer.Generator¶
play() → None¶

Play self.generator.

source: synthizer.Source¶
earwax.sound.get_buffer(protocol: str, path: str) → synthizer.Buffer¶

Get a Buffer instance. Buffers are cached in the buffers dictionary, so if there is already a buffer with the given protocol and path, it will be returned. Otherwise, a new buffer will be created, and added to the dictionary:

# Returns True.
assert isinstance(get_buffer('file', 'sound.wav'), synthizer.Buffer)

If you are going to destroy a buffer, make sure you remove it from the buffers dictionary.
